                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>School of Education (University of Michigan) records, 1904-[ongoing].</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>School records consisting of executive committee and faculty meeting minutes, subject files concerning in part promotion and tenure decisions, teacher certification, programs in Detroit Public Schools, the School's accreditation review in 1973-1974, and the University's review of the School in 1982-1984. Topical files of various deans and administrative officers, notably James B. Edmonson, Willard Olson, Carl F. Berger, Frederick W. Bertolaet, Joan Stark, and Charles F. Lehmann; and information on programs and departments at one time administered by the School, including Department of Physical Education, Fresh Air Camp, Bureau of School Services, and vocational education. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Michigan</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: School of Education (University of Michigan) records, 1904-[ongoing].
resource.abstract: School records consisting of executive committee and faculty meeting minutes, subject files concerning in part promotion and tenure decisions, teacher certification, programs in Detroit Public Schools, the School's accreditation review in 1973-1974, and the University's review of the School in 1982-1984. Topical files of various deans and administrative officers, notably James B. Edmonson, Willard Olson, Carl F. Berger, Frederick W. Bertolaet, Joan Stark, and Charles F. Lehmann; and information on programs and departments at one time administered by the School, including Department of Physical Education, Fresh Air Camp, Bureau of School Services, and vocational education.

                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Marquis E. Shattuck papers, 1868-1984.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>This collection contains papers of Mr. Shattuck's organizational affiliations, his many years with the Detroit Public Schools, and with his genealogy and historical interests. Of particular note is an autographed letter from Michigan Governor G. Mennen Williams (Box 45:2). The oldest items in the collection may be found with Detroit Public Schools Historical Materials, 1868-1882 (Box 35:8 and 10) and SAR applications which date back to 1894 (Box 5:7) and year books, dating from 1890 (Box 11:3). </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Detroit Public Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

The oldest items in the collection may be found with Detroit Public Schools Historical Materials, 1868-1882 (Box 35:8 and 10) and SAR applications which date back to 1894 (Box 5:7) and year books, dating from 1890 (Box 11:3).
resource.extent: 23 linear ft. (45 boxes, 4 volumes, 1 large manuscript)

School records consisting of executive committee and faculty meeting minutes, subject files concerning in part promotion and tenure decisions, teacher certification, programs in Detroit Public Schools, the School's accreditation review in 1973-1974, and the University's review of the School in 1982-1984. Topical files of various deans and administrative officers, notably James B. Edmonson, Willard Olson, Carl F. Berger, Frederick W. Bertolaet, Joan Stark, and Charles F. Lehmann; and information on programs and departments at one time administered by the School, including Department of Physical Education, Fresh Air Camp, Bureau of School Services, and vocational education.
